description: Middle English jessera(u)nt, gessera(u)nt(e), from Old French jazerant, from Old Occitan jazerenc, from Arabic جَزَائِرِيّ‎ (jazāʔiriyy, “Algerian, of Algiers”), derived from الجَزَائِر‎ (al-jazāʔir, “Algiers; Algeria”).

entries.meaning: (historical) A coat of defense of Arab origin, made of small plates of metal sewn upon linen or similar, like a brigandine.
This kind of armor taken generally.
